snippet: British officials said the delay amounted to the halving of a payment of 2.1 billion euros, but ministers of other European countries said Britain would end up paying the full amount.
abstract: European Union authorities craft deal, involving change to European law that will require approval from member governments, allowing Great Britain to defer payment of 2.1 billion euros, or about $2.6 billion, to EU.
lead_paragraph: British officials said the delay amounted to the halving of a payment of 2.1 billion euros, but ministers of other European countries said Britain would end up paying the full amount.

headline.main: Britain Is Granted Delay in Payment to European Union
headline.print_headline: Britain: Payment to European Union May Be Deferred
